document.title: Installation
document.description: How to install and set up Serum UI in your project

body.raw:
# Installation Get started with Serum UI by installing it in your React project. ## Requirements - React 18 or later - Tailwind CSS 3.0 or later ## Install Package Install Serum UI using your preferred package manager: ```bash pnpm add @serum/ui ``` ```bash npm install @serum/ui ``` ```bash yarn add @serum/ui ``` ## Configure Tailwind CSS Add Serum UI to your Tailwind CSS configuration: ```js title="tailwind.config.js" /** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */ module.exports = { content: [ "./src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}", "./node_modules/@serum/ui/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}", ], theme: { extend: {}, }, plugins: [], } ``` ## Import Styles Import the Serum UI styles in your main CSS file or layout component: ```css title="globals.css" @import "@serum/ui/dist/styles.css"; ``` Or in your layout component: ```tsx title="layout.tsx" import "@serum/ui/dist/styles.css" ``` ## Start Building You're all set! Start using Serum UI components in your application: ```tsx import { Button } from "@serum/ui" export default function App() { return (
) } ```

document.title: Introduction
document.description: Modern, accessible React components built with Tailwind CSS

body.raw:
# Serum UI

Serum UI is a modern, accessible React component library built on top of Tailwind CSS. It provides a set of beautifully crafted components that you can use to build fast, responsive web applications.

## Philosophy

Our goal is to provide components that are:

- **Accessible by default** - All components follow WAI-ARIA guidelines
- **Customizable** - Easy to theme and extend with Tailwind CSS
- **Developer friendly** - Simple APIs with TypeScript support
- **Modern** - Built with the latest React patterns and best practices

## Getting Started

To get started with Serum UI, check out our [Installation](/installation) guide or jump straight into exploring our [Components](/components/button).

## Features

- 🎨 **Beautiful Design** - Carefully crafted components with modern aesthetics
- ♿ **Accessible** - Built with accessibility in mind from the ground up
- 🎯 **TypeScript** - Full TypeScript support with detailed type definitions
- 🎨 **Customizable** - Easy theming with CSS variables and Tailwind CSS
- 📱 **Responsive** - Mobile-first design principles
- ⚡ **Performance** - Optimized bundle size and runtime performance

document.title: Button
document.description: A customizable button component with multiple variants and sizes

body.raw:
# Button A versatile button component that supports multiple variants, sizes, and states. ## Examples ### Variants
### Sizes
### Loading State
### Disabled State
## Usage ```tsx import { Button } from "@serum/ui" export default function Example() { return (
) } ``` ## Props | Prop | Type | Default | Description | |------|------|---------|-------------| | `variant` | `"primary" \| "secondary" \| "ghost"` | `"primary"` | The visual style variant | | `size` | `"sm" \| "md" \| "lg"` | `"md"` | The size of the button | | `isLoading` | `boolean` | `false` | Shows loading spinner when true | | `disabled` | `boolean` | `false` | Disables the button | | `children` | `React.ReactNode` | - | The button content | | `className` | `string` | - | Additional CSS classes | | `onClick` | `() => void` | - | Click handler function | The Button component also accepts all standard HTML button attributes.
